items.title: A first look at Microsoft’s new Xbox Copilot
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Microsoft is testing an early version of Xbox Copilot within the Xbox mobile app, designed to integrate with user Xbox accounts.
- The Copilot can display achievements, give game recommendations, provide tips, and assist with downloading and installing games.
- It supports typing or voice commands, with varied voice options like energetic and heroic; animated AI characters are in development.
- Future features may include Copilot Vision, allowing the AI to see during gameplay on PC for more comprehensive assistance.
- The initial Xbox Copilot for Gaming will be available to Xbox Insiders soon, with plans for broader release after feedback.
- Microsoft is increasingly integrating Xbox titles into Battle.net, including recent and upcoming games for Game Pass, indicating expanded PC game launcher options.
- The article also covers various Microsoft updates: data center slowdowns, the upcoming Recall feature for Copilot PCs, enabling of ActiveX controls in Microsoft 365, new GPT-4.1 models in Azure, Windows 11 update rollouts, Windows vulnerabilities, a leaked Elder Scrolls remaster, new Snipping Tool features, a quirky MS Paint mirror product, support for Nintendo Switch 2, and Copilot Studio's new AI interaction capabilities.

items.title: FTC v. Meta live: Mark Zuckerberg takes the stand
Spotify is down
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Spotify is experiencing widespread outages across the US and Europe, affecting loading and streaming of music.
- The Spotify Status account acknowledged the issues at 8:45AM ET on Wednesday, stating they are checking them out.
- The problems are impacting the web player, desktop app, and iOS app, with various user reports indicating failure to load content or play songs.
- A spike in US outages was reported by Downdetector, with implications of global impact per the outage map from ThousandEyes.
- The cause of the outages remains unclear, and no timeline for resolution has been provided.

items.title: Patreon is getting livestreaming
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Patreon is launching a livestreaming feature, starting this week for select creators in an early access test.
- Wider rollout of livestreaming is planned for summer 2023, allowing creators to stream live from mobile or desktop.
- Creators can choose between free or paid streams and will have access to live chat, moderation tools, and integration with streaming tools like OBS and Streamlabs.
- Creators can share recordings (VODs) or sell them as one-time purchases.
- Thousands of creators are involved in the test, aiming to enhance community engagement.

items.title: Aura’s new Aspen looks even more like a traditional photo frame
items.author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy
items.summary:
- Aura's newest digital photo frame, the Aspen, is priced at $229 and features a 12-inch anti-glare display.
- The frame has a 4:3 aspect ratio and offers improved photo sharing capabilities compared to its predecessor, the 10-inch Carver frame.
- New features include text captions, people search, and the ability to display Live photos as mini-movies.
- Available for horizontal or portrait positioning, it comes with a slim 0.5-inch bezel, and a built-in ambient light sensor to adjust brightness.
- The frame can sync photos from Google Photos or iCloud, and supports video playback up to 30 seconds long.

items.title: Nvidia’s latest GPU drivers fix lots of bugs and crashes
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Nvidia released a new GPU driver (576.02) addressing numerous bug fixes and crashes.
- The driver fixes stability issues in Windows 11 version 24H2 and addresses various game crashes including in Fortnite and Overwatch 2.
- The update supports the new RTX 5060 Ti GPU launching at $379.

items.title: In pursuit of a viral, five-year-old compact camera
items.author: Allison Johnson

items.title: Microsoft enables AI agents to autonomously use computers with Copilot Studio
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Microsoft has introduced a new "computer use" feature for Copilot Studio, allowing AI agents to interact with websites and applications autonomously.
- This feature enables agents to automate tasks such as data entry, market research, and processing invoices, even in the absence of APIs.
- The Copilot Studio can recognize changes in interfaces and adapt accordingly, ensuring continuous functionality.
- A similar feature called Actions has been added to consumer Copilot, enabling background task performance while users work on other tasks, but with limited partners compared to the broader application potential of Copilot Studio.

items.title: The ‘Oscars of Science’ can’t take a Trump joke
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- The Breakthrough Prize, often called 'the Oscars of Science', faced backlash after Seth Rogen's comments about Trump during the April 5th livestream.
- Rogen's joke about Trump destroying American science was removed from the full video of the ceremony.
- Each award given out is worth $3 million, and the ceremony was not televised, leading to unclear scheduling needs for editing.

items.title: BougeRV’s electric wagon is the uphill king and downhill menace
items.author: Thomas Ricker
items.summary:
- BougeRV's Electric Foldable Wagon priced at $399.99.
- Designed for hauling up to 200kg (440 pounds) effortlessly over steep inclines.
- Features include a 180-liter capacity expandable to 250 liters, electronic throttle, and rear-wheel drive motors.
- Positive aspects: Flattens steep hills, huge carrying capacity, folds for easy transport, good range.
- Negative aspects: Poor display visibility in sunlight, ineffective electronic brakes downhill, expensive, no solid rain protection.
- Maximum range claimed at 12 miles (19km) with a removable 133Wh USB-C rechargeable battery.
- Noted performance issues, especially on downhill slopes and over soft surfaces like sand.

items.title: Zuckerberg’s antitrust testimony aired his wildest ideas in Meta’s history
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- Mark Zuckerberg testified in a federal antitrust case against Meta regarding its acquisitions of Instagram and WhatsApp.
- He considered radical ideas for Meta's future, including making Instagram separate and creating a feed only for ads.
- The FTC argues Meta has monopoly power, while Zuckerberg claims the market is more fluid, citing TikTok and YouTube as rivals.
- Zuckerberg revealed internal discussions about potentially wiping user friends lists and other significant strategic decisions.
- The case continues with implications for Meta's structure and future operations.

items.title: Skullcandy partners with Bose for its new $99 ANC earbuds
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Skullcandy launches Method 360 ANC earbuds at a special price of $99.99, raising to $129.99 later.
- Features audio tuning by Bose for enhanced sound quality, including various ear gel sizes for comfort.
- The earbuds offer a sliding charging case that boosts battery life up to 40 hours without ANC, or 32 hours with ANC.
- Available in five colors: black, bone, primer, plasma, and leopard.
- Includes a four-microphone hybrid ANC system and features like wear detection and multipoint pairing.
- IPX4 rating for sweat and water resistance, and connectivity with Skull-iQ app for customization.

items.title: The student arrested at his naturalization interview knew it was coming
items.author: Gaby Del Valle
items.summary:
- Mohsen Mahdawi anticipated his USCIS naturalization interview might lead to his arrest.
- He had been in hiding for weeks due to fears of detention by ICE, yet he felt compelled to attend the appointment.
- Mahdawi was arrested on April 14th, shortly after his interview began, despite having no prior criminal record.
- His involvement in Columbia University’s pro-Palestine protests reportedly made him a target under the Trump administration's immigration policies.
- His attorneys filed a habeas corpus petition on the same day as his arrest, seeking his release and protection from deportation.
- A federal judge issued a temporary restraining order preventing his deportation for the time being.

items.title: OpenAI names new nonprofit ‘advisors’
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- OpenAI has appointed Dolores Huerta, Monica Lozano, Dr. Robert K. Ross, and Jack Oliver as advisors for its new nonprofit commission.
- The advisors will assist in informing OpenAI’s philanthropic efforts.
- Their appointment follows OpenAI's recent plan to transition to a for-profit company, which has faced criticism from former employees and nonprofit leaders.
- OpenAI emphasizes that its nonprofit mission remains intact and aims to expand its impact on global challenges like health and education.

items.title: Here are the best AirPods deals you can get right now
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- Discounts on Apple AirPods Max, AirPods 4 (with/without ANC), and AirPods Pro with USB-C are currently available.
- AirPods 4 priced at $119, improving sound quality, voice clarity, and comfort. The noise-canceling model costs $169.
- Apple introduced AirPods 4 at the September event, with $30 discounts noted on the standard model.
- The AirPods Pro (second-gen) available for $189.99, offering enhanced noise cancellation and sound quality, now with USB-C.
- AirPods Max are priced at $479.99, featuring excellent build quality, noise cancellation, and spatial audio.

items.title: ChatGPT now has a section for your AI-generated images
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- OpenAI is introducing an image library for ChatGPT, accessible to Free, Plus, and Pro users on mobile and web.
- Users can view a grid of AI-generated images from the new 'Library' section in the ChatGPT sidebar.
- The feature is aimed at improving accessibility for users who frequently create images using ChatGPT.

items.title: The CVE program for tracking security flaws is about to lose federal funding
items.author: Emma Roth

items.title: Meta’s antitrust trial slide redactions aren’t actually hiding anything
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- A PDF of Meta's opening statement in its FTC antitrust hearing revealed poorly executed redactions.
- The exposed content includes comparisons between Apple's Messages and Meta's apps like Instagram and WhatsApp.
- The leakage draws parallels to a previous incident involving Sony's mishandling of confidential documents in the Microsoft antitrust trial.

items.title: Mark Zuckerberg once suggested wiping all Facebook friends lists to boost usage
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- In 2022, Mark Zuckerberg proposed a radical idea to enhance Facebook's usage: deleting all users' friends lists.  
- The suggestion was made during his testimony for Meta’s antitrust trial, reflecting concerns over Facebook's declining relevance.  
- Zuckerberg considered a staggered implementation, starting with a small country, to gauge user response.  
- Facebook leadership expressed skepticism over the viability of this plan, citing the importance of friend connections.  
- Recently, Meta has shifted strategies with the launch of a revamped friends tab, emphasizing a return to earlier Facebook features.

items.title: Blackmagic Design says tariffs have made camera price hikes ‘unavoidable’
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Blackmagic Design cites tariffs as the reason for unavoidable price increases in the US for their products.
- The company originally planned to build a factory in Dallas to streamline supply but tariffs complicate this project.
- A supply chain survey found 61% of businesses would prefer lower-tariff locations over the US, and 81% would automate rather than hire.
- The price of the Pyxis 12K camera increased from $5,000 to $6,600, before settling at $5,500 after production adjustments.
- The Trump Administration has exempted some electronics from tariffs, but no clear exemption exists for camera manufacturing.

items.title: Mark Zuckerberg suggested spinning off Instagram
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- In 2018, Mark Zuckerberg suggested spinning off Instagram as a separate company.
- This suggestion was made amid an FTC antitrust investigation into Meta's acquisitions of Instagram and WhatsApp.
- Zuckerberg noted that companies often perform better after being split up and warned his executive team about potential pressures to divest these acquisitions.
- The FTC alleges that Meta illegally monopolized the social media market through these acquisitions, seeking to unwind them.
- Zuckerberg acknowledges the business value of keeping Instagram and Facebook together but considers the possibility of a spin-off as not entirely unlikely.

items.title: Anthropic is reportedly launching a voice AI you can speak to
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Anthropic is preparing to introduce a new voice mode feature for its AI chatbot Claude.
- The feature will include three voice options: Mellow, Airy, and Buttery.
- The rollout of this voice mode could begin as soon as April 2025.
- The initiative aims to compete with OpenAI's voice feature in ChatGPT.
- This has been confirmed by Bloomberg and was previously hinted by Anthropic's product officer, Mike Kreiger.
- References to voice mode were first discovered in Anthropic's iOS app by researcher M1Astra.

items.title: On TikTok, Chinese factories are trolling anxious American shoppers
items.author: Mia Sato
items.summary:
- Viral TikTok videos showcase Chinese manufacturers selling knockoffs of popular American products at low prices.
- Products include fake Birkenstocks for $10, claiming to cut out the middleman, appealing to American shoppers amid tariff anxieties.
- Many products advertised as luxury goods may be replicas, with investigations revealing they are not genuine brands but cheaper alternatives that look similar.

items.title: Google Search is going to be google.com globally
items.author: Jay Peters

items.title: Dune: Awakening will slumber for just a bit longer
items.author: Ash Parrish

items.title: Amazon’s latest Fire HD tablets are now on sale starting at $95
items.author: Barbara Krasnoff
items.summary:
- Amazon has launched sales on its latest Fire HD tablets starting at $94.99 for the 32GB Fire HD 10 model, down from $139.99.
- The 64GB model is now available for $104.99, a $75 discount.
- The Fire HD 10 features a 10.1-inch 1080p display, 3GB of RAM, and support for the Made for Amazon Stylus Pen and handwriting recognition.
- Other models without ads are priced at $109.99 for the 32GB version and $119.99 for the 64GB version.
- The kid-friendly Amazon Fire 10 HD Kids version is on sale for $139.99, down from $189.99, and includes a child-proof case and a two-year warranty.

items.title: Google’s geothermal energy ambitions are growing
items.author: Justine Calma
items.summary:
- Google signed its first geothermal power purchase agreement for its facilities in Asia, marking a first for Taiwan.
- The agreement is part of Google's climate goals to reduce emissions and achieve carbon-free electricity by 2030.
- The deal, with Baseload Capital, aims to add 10 megawatts of geothermal energy to Taiwan’s grid by 2029, doubling its capacity.
- Google will invest in Baseload Capital and is exploring similar geothermal projects in Japan and Indonesia.
- Michael Terrell from Google stressed that this agreement could scale corporate geothermal procurement worldwide.

items.title: It’s time for Europe to choose between US or Chinese satellite tech, says FCC chair
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- FCC Chair Brendan Carr warns Europe faces a choice between US and Chinese satellite technology.
- He criticizes the influence of politics on European decisions regarding satellite services.
- European nations reconsider partnerships with Starlink, owned by SpaceX, due to recent comments from Elon Musk regarding Ukraine.
- European alternatives to Starlink lag behind, with Eutelsat operating significantly fewer satellites.
- China’s satellite constellation operator is rapidly advancing, planning to launch 15,000 satellites by 2030.

items.title: Anthropic launches research tool and Google Workspace integration
items.author: Kylie Robison
items.summary:
- Anthropic introduces two features: Research tool and Google Workspace integration.
- Claude can now connect to Gmail, Google Calendar, and Documents, acting as a workplace assistant.
- New Research feature allows Claude to perform multiple, context-building searches with citations.
- Available in early beta for Max, Team, and Enterprise plans in the US, Japan, and Brazil; Google Workspace integration in beta for all paid users.
- Plans to release Research for lower tiers and enhance document searching using retrieval augmented generation techniques.
- Anthropic addresses concerns about hallucinations and privacy with user-level authentication for access to documents.

items.title: Google rolls out its AI video generator to Gemini Advanced subscribers
items.author: Emma Roth

items.title: Kill your crewmates in 3D when Among Us 3D launches in May
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- Among Us 3D launches on May 6th for $9.99.
- The game is compatible with Meta Quest, PSVR2, Steam VR headsets, and PC via Steam with cross-play capabilities.
- New features include additional game modes, in-game voice chat, and cosmetics.
- Exclusive new game mode called Tag Mode, where players can infect each other.

items.title: Google must stop favoring Search and Chrome on Android in Japan
items.author: Wes Davis

items.title: Tom Hiddleston dances through the new Life of Chuck trailer
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- The new trailer for *The Life of Chuck*, based on a Stephen King short story, features a significant dance sequence by Tom Hiddleston.
- Directed by Mike Flanagan, known for adaptations like *The Haunting of Hill House*, the film is a heartwarming story touching on post-apocalyptic themes.
- *The Life of Chuck* stars Hiddleston alongside Chiwetel Ejiofor, Karen Gillan, Jacob Tremblay, and Mark Hamill.
- The film premiered at the Toronto International Film Festival and will be released in theaters on June 13, 2025.

items.title: Comcast announces a five-year price lock for Xfinity internet plans
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Comcast offers new customers a five-year price lock on Xfinity internet plans.
- Prices range from $55 to $105 per month without annual contracts and include unlimited data.
- Plans feature a modem/router combo and a 12-month complimentary Xfinity Mobile plan, with additional lines costing $20/month.
- Available tiers with corresponding speeds include: 400/150 Mbps at $55, 600/150 Mbps at $70, 1.1 Gbps/300 Mbps at $85, and 2.1 Gbps/300 Mbps at $105.
- The offer is valid across all markets.
- Prices for fiber internet plans are also included with symmetrical upload and download speeds for select tiers.

items.title: 4chan’s ‘cesspool of the internet’ is down after apparently being hacked
items.author: Emma Roth

items.title: OpenAI is building a social network
items.author: Kylie Robison

items.title: Leaked images suggest Oblivion remaster coming soon
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
• An announcement for an Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion Remastered is expected soon.
• Leaked images found on developer Virtuous's website show side-by-side comparisons of the original and remastered versions.
• The remaster includes updated art, such as a new logo and deluxe box art.
• Rumors about the remaster surfaced in 2023 via documents in the FTC’s case against Microsoft regarding their acquisition of Zeni-Max studios.
• Microsoft is rumored to be planning a late spring or early summer release, with a potential stealth release next week.

items.title: Notion Mail is a minimalist but powerful take on email
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- Notion has launched Notion Mail, its new email app, competing with Microsoft Office and Google Workspace.
- The app features AI-powered organization, allowing users to auto-label similar emails and create custom views for better inbox management.
- Currently, Notion Mail is only available for Gmail accounts, with iOS testing ongoing, and lacks support for Windows and other mobile platforms.

items.title: Why Doctor Who’s latest robot threat is a dangerous AI: ‘this is what’s happening’
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- The newest season of *Doctor Who* features an episode titled “The Robot Revolution,” focusing on an army of killer machines.
- Showrunner Russell T. Davies states that AI-powered machines are the modern villains the Doctor faces, reflecting real-world issues.
- The episode critiques incel culture and the dangers of AI through its plot twist involving the character Al, who becomes a human-machine hybrid.
- Belinda Chandra calls Missbelindachandra-1 “the planet of the incels” to underline the episode's commentary.
- The narrative digs into societal issues reflected in AI development, emphasizing that AI reflects humanity’s conflicts and ideologies.

items.title: The Best MagSafe and Qi2 Chargers
items.author: Antonio G. Di Benedetto
items.summary:
- Wireless charging is slower than wired but offers convenience, especially with magnetic chargers.
- Qi2 chargers are recommended for iPhone 12 or later (except iPhone 16E) with fast charging of up to 15W.
- Samsung Galaxy S25 is "Qi2 Ready" requiring a special case for magnetic charging.
- Qi2 standard offers more options and affordability compared to MagSafe certified chargers.
- iPhone 16 can charge up to 25W with the updated MagSafe charger available in 1m and 2m lengths.
- Anker’s MagGo 15W charger is cheaper and includes an AC adapter, compared to Apple's offerings.
- Travel-friendly options like the Satechi 3-in-1 charger cater to those with multiple devices.
- Belkin's 3-in-1 stand allows charging at home with improved design and adjustable angles for comfort.

items.title: Where to buy refurbished products
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary:
- Buying refurbished devices can save money and reduce dependence on global trade.
- Refurbished products may have been repaired or returned and are subject to US laws for reselling.
- Best Buy, Amazon, and eBay have extensive programs for buying refurbished products, each with different terms and warranties.
- Companies like Apple and Google offer refurbished products with significant discounts and warranties.
- Different retailers have varying levels of refurbishment quality and warranty options, so thorough research is advised before purchasing.

items.title: What you should know before buying refurbished gadgets
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary:
- Buying refurbished gadgets can save money and reduce e-waste.
- 'Refurbished' can mean the product was repaired or returned, differing by seller.
- U.S. laws prevent once-used tech from being sold as new.
- Important questions to consider: condition, included accessories, warranty details.
- First-party refurbished products are generally more reliable than third-party.
- Open-box items typically refer to products returned in original condition with accessories.
- Caution advised with refurbished items like headphones or mice due to cleanliness concerns.
- Ensure adequate warranty support when purchasing refurbished devices.
- Article updated on April 15, 2025, for accuracy.

items.title: Nanoleaf’s new pegboard dock lights up your accessories and room
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- The Nanoleaf Pegboard Desk Dock organizes accessories like controllers and headphones while providing mood lighting.
- Features 32 full-color LEDs and a reconfigurable design to hold devices securely.
- Available for $49.99 online; Walmart will carry it starting in May.
- Comes with three USB ports for charging devices at up to 15W and connects to a computer for additional customization via the Nanoleaf app.
- Offers preprogrammed lighting scenes and sync capabilities for games and music.

items.title: Nvidia’s RTX 5060 Ti arrives on April 16th starting at $379
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Nvidia announces the RTX 5060 family of GPUs, launching the RTX 5060 Ti on April 16th.
- Two RTX 5060 Ti variants: $379 for 8GB VRAM and $429 for 16GB VRAM. The RTX 5060 with 8GB will launch in May for $299.
- RTX 5060 Ti features 4,608 CUDA cores, a base clock of 2.4GHz, boost clock of 2.57GHz, and a 128-bit memory bus.
- Supports DLSS 4 and Multi Frame Generation, with power consumption of 180 watts for Ti and 145 watts for regular.
- High frame rates in various games demonstrated, with significant performance improvements over previous generations expected.
- Nvidia not producing Founders Edition cards for this series, affecting availability at launch price.
- Dell and others will release laptops with the RTX 5060 starting at $1,099 in May.

items.title: The 2025 Vergecast Streaming Draft
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- The Vergecast hosts hold their third annual Streaming Draft to predict the future of streaming services.
- Each host selects services across seven categories including Cheap, Awards, 4K, Live, Niche, Content, and Wild Card.
- Last year's results were recapped, with hosts' picks showcasing a variety of streaming platforms.
- Speculation included the future of streaming services like Fox's upcoming service and Disney’s ESPN flagship app.

items.title: Polaroid’s new instant camera warns you about exposure and focus issues before you shoot
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- The Polaroid Flip camera offers warnings for exposure and focus issues with a red LED in the viewfinder.
- Launch date: April 29th for $199.99 from Polaroid’s online store, retail availability on May 13th.
- Features a folding design, powerful adjustable flash, sonar autofocus with four fixed lenses, and compatibility with Polaroid i-Type and 600 film.
- Includes a replaceable rechargeable battery and Bluetooth connectivity with the Polaroid app for additional functionality.

items.title: Android phones will soon reboot if they’re locked for a few days
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- A new Android security feature will reboot devices locked for 3 consecutive days.
- The update aims to enhance data protection by requiring a passcode upon reboot.
- Applicable to Android phones and tablets, but not other devices like Auto, TV, and WearOS.
- The reboot transitions devices to a Before First Unlock (BFU) state, encrypting data files.
- Apple has a similar feature in iOS 18.1 that triggers after four days of inactivity.

items.title: Hertz says hackers stole customer credit card and driver’s license data
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Hertz confirmed a data breach affecting customer credit card and personal information due to vulnerabilities in the Cleo Communications file transfer platform.
- The breach occurred between October and December 2024 and was reported on February 10, 2025.
- Data exposed includes names, contact info, dates of birth, credit card details, and driver’s license information; a small number also had Social Security numbers compromised.
- The incident is being reported to law enforcement and relevant regulators, with Cleo addressing the vulnerabilities.
- Hertz has not disclosed the number of impacted customers and stated there is no known misuse of the stolen information.

items.title: Mark Zuckerberg takes the stand
items.author: Alex Heath

items.title: The Best iPad Deals You Can Get Right Now
items.author: Brandon Widder
items.summary:
- Best iPad deals available outside major sale events such as Black Friday and Amazon Prime Day.
- Recent discounts on models include iPad Pro, iPad Mini, iPad Air, and base iPad.
- 10th-gen iPad currently available at Walmart starting at $269 and previously sold for $349.
- 11th-gen iPad launched with improvements, currently priced at $328 on Amazon.
- 2024 iPad Mini priced starting at $499 with 128GB storage.
- New iPad Air models include M2 and M3 chips with competitive pricing and minimal discounts.
